programme.desc: Fresh from another classic top-flight contest with Liverpool, Eddie Howe's Newcastle pay a visit to Brentford. After 14 games played, both sides are locked on 20 points apiece. (07.12)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Nuno Espirito Santo and Nottingham Forest bring back-to-back wins to the capital, as Thomas Frank's Brentford look to end the visitors' winning run at the Gtech Community Stadium. (21.12)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Russell Martin's Southampton take to the capital for their third Premier League game of the season, as they travel to Brentford. Thomas Frank's Bees lost at Anfield last weekend. (31.08)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Two stuttering London sides collide at the Gtech Community Stadium, as Thomas Frank's Brentford host Julen Lopetegui's out of form West Ham United in the Premier League. (28.09)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Thomas Frank's Bees host Gary O'Neil's Wolves. Last weekend, Brentford became the first team in history to score in the opening minute in three consecutive Premier League games. (05.10)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: David Moyes and Everton travel to the Amex to face Fabian Hurzeler's Brighton. Victory at Old Trafford kept the Seagulls in touch with the pack targeting European qualification. (25.01)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Fabian Hurzeler targets a fourth consecutive Premier League win for his side with the visit of Fulham to the Amex. The visitors are just one point behind eighth-placed Brighton. (08.03)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Kieran McKenna's Ipswich go to the Amex in search of their first Premier League win of the campaign, as Fabian Hurzeler's impressive Brighton stand in the way of the Tractor Boys. (14.09)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: After back-to-back defeats, Brighton target a return to form with the visit of relegation-bound Leicester, who earlier in the week lost their eighth home league game in a row. (12.04)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Two teams without a win in their last five Premier League games, Brighton and West Ham meet at the Amex. The Seagulls' latest defeat to Brentford dented their European aspirations. (26.04)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Brighton return to the Amex having taken three Premier League points from St James' Park last weekend, as Fabian Hurzeler's impressive Seagulls host bottom-of-the-table Wolves. (26.10)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: After mauling Barrow in midweek, Chelsea return to Premier League action as they welcome unbeaten Brighton - who have drawn their last three - to Stamford Bridge. (28.09)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: As European hopefuls Bournemouth arrive at Selhurst Park for a Premier League clash with Crystal Palace, five points separates the Cherries in eighth and Palace down in 12th. (19.04)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Five points is the gap for Ipswich to nearest relegation rivals Wolves. Can Kieran McKenna's side upset in-form Crystal Palace away from home at Selhurst Park in the Premier League? (08.03)

programme.title: Drink It In
programme.desc: Manchester City's rise has been nothing short of meteoric; from an 8-1 humbling in 2008, to six-time Premier League winners. Follow the record breaking journey of the noisy neighbours.

programme.title: Unpacked
programme.desc: Pep Guardiola unpacks life as a top-flight manager by answering questions you've always wanted to ask a Premier League boss.

programme.title: Unpacked
programme.desc: Marc Cucurella unpacks life as a top flight footballer by answering the questions you've always wanted to ask a Premier League player.

programme.title: Transfer 360

programme.title: Transfer 360
programme.desc: Find out the inside story of Sol Campbell's move from Spurs to Arsenal, as David Dein, Lord Sugar and Campbell detail how one of the Premier League's most controversial transfers unfolded.

programme.title: Transfer 360
programme.desc: Find out the inside story of Jay-Jay Okocha's move to Bolton. Hear from Sam Allardyce, ex-teammates and Okocha himself on one of the biggest transfer coups in Premier League history.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Mario Been blies onlangs zestig kaarsjes uit. Om dat te vieren besloten zijn vrienden om hem mee terug te nemen naar het Italiaanse Pisa, waar Been drie jaar speelde voor de plaatselijke club. In 'Grande Mario' reizen we met drie voetbalvrienden terug in de tijd, naar de gloriejaren van de Serie A.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Mario Been blies onlangs zestig kaarsjes uit. Om dat te vieren besloten zijn vrienden om hem mee terug te nemen naar het Italiaanse Pisa, waar Been drie jaar speelde voor de plaatselijke club. In 'Grande Mario' reizen we met drie voetbalvrienden terug in de tijd, naar de gloriejaren van de Serie A.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Louis van Gaal staat bekend als trainer van grote clubs als Ajax, Barcelona, Bayern München en Manchester United. Maar in zijn spelerscarrière stond één club centraal: Sparta Rotterdam. In deze documentaire wordt teruggeblikt op de jaren 1978 tot 1986, de prachtige jaren van Sparta, met Louis van Gaal als vaste waarde.

programme.title: ESPN Film
programme.desc: Greg LeMond kijkt terug op de spraakmakende Tour de France van 1986. De Amerikaan won die ronde en moest daarvoor afrekenen met vriend, teamgenoot en mentor Bernard Hinault, de man die in 1985 zijn vijfde Tour had gewonnen.

programme.desc: Ontdek hoe de Formule E tot stand gekomen is. In 2012 ontstond het idee voor een elektrisch aangedreven autosportklasse. Het eerste kampioenschap vond plaats in het seizoen 2014-2015, terwijl in 2013 enkele demonstratie-evenementen werden gehouden.
